moves.1. e4: Hello my fellow chess playing fans.I  would like to share this game with you.My opponent lost this game in way i once did in a bad habit i once did a lot.Hopefully i have broken this habit.It waspointed out to me and worked on  by my friend ,trachess,THE GREATEST CHESS PLAYER I EVER KNOWN.I dedicate this annotation to him.Okay here we go.I OPEN WITH E4
moves.1... e5: Standard e5 response.The e5 response has caused me trouble in past,i have been victim of "fools mate".This is what i try to set up.
moves.2... Nf6: Opponent counters with Nf6 maybe thinks i setting up for bishop and queen attack.Which i was going to do
moves.3. Nf3: Nf3 so i can castle next
moves.4... Nxe4: Here is where my opponent  starts to lose game.Attacking to quickly with not enough development.Been guity of this mistake also.
moves.5. Qe2: Spooking cowboy(PLEASE FORGIVE HALLOWEEN  REFERANCE LOL) Looking back i also could have went d3 and started chain then he would have possibly went Ng3 sacficing Ng3 if i had went h2xNg3.If i had done this he would have hole in wall and he would have walked in withQ and Bc8.Or if for some reason i left Ng3 he could have Ng3xRf1
moves.5... Nf6: RETREAT!!!His development now in real trouble.If you notice i have a lot of pressure on center
moves.6. Nc3: Bring out other cowboy.Riding hard toward victory
moves.6... Bg4: Admit this  is a good pin.But notice what i do next
moves.7... Bxf3: Expected i am now 2 pieces down.But Bf3 has no backup.Some say this is piece for piece.But to what advantage?What was that old saying of a thousand cuts?
moves.8. Qxf3: Cancel Bf3 like a stamp.I am now better developed and only 8 moves into game.
moves.8... Be7: He moves Be7 backing up Nf6
moves.9. Bg5: Pin.Also i am setting up for the kill with both bishops and Queen.Nf6 is in my way my only problem.
moves.9... Nfd7: Okay major blunder here.I believe he was thinking i would move  Bg5 because Be7 is backed up with queen and king.But he did not look at whole board.Been guilty of this myself.His king in my crosshairs.
moves.10. Qxf7#: BANG!!!Qxf7 backed up by Bc4 and Bg5.Kinda like a arrowhead huh?Under development and fruitless unsupported early attack cost game for my opponent.I hope you have enjoyed this annotation and possibly learned something.As always postive feedback accepted,negative tolerated.Have a nice day!
